comments:
Hi,
trying to run Eclipse on Mustang b80 (and from searches on the internet, on b78 and b79 too) I get the following stack trace on startup:

!SESSION 2006-04-17 15:58:31.828 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I20060413-1718

java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=it_IT
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

!MESSAGE Application error

By the way, Eclipse 3.1.2 starts just fine with Mustang b80

Closing as INVALID since this is an ICU bug.
See http://dev.icu-project.org/cgi-bin/icu-bugs/others?id=5147;page=18;user=guest

I unserstand your position, yet this is a blocker for 3.2 release, it's not just a degradation, Eclipse won't start at all. The stack trace is the same, but it has been triggered just after asking what workspace I wanted to use.
In my opinion you should keep this one open and blocker, unless you want to release a 3.2.0.1 a couple of weeks after 3.2.0...
Reopening to assign to the right component.

From the stack trace, ICU is used by Platform UI. 

Moving to Platform UI for comment.
Andrea - The ICU component wasn't part of 3.1.x, which may explain what you are seeing. Note also that this could just be a bug in Mustang-b80, which isn't product quality yet (pre-beta2 only).

I can confirm the problem is there from b78 onwards, and the stack trace is totally in ICU classes, no sign or java.*** code.
So, if it's a regression, someone should report it explaining what happened, otherwise the ICU code should be fixed. In the current state, Eclipse is not able to run on the 3 of the latest Mustang snapshots, and we are close to java 1.6 release...

I also had same problem.
Though I report this problem to mustang forum...
I was shunted off to here :-P
As their saying,
 the exception didn't occured in mustang class as we see the stack trace.

If you think it might be a bug of mustang,
please research and report by as some eclipse developer.
Karice, I've given this to you since there's "ICU" stuff in teh callback. Let me know if I should reassign.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 134689 ***

traces.message: Can't map string pool offset 20273 to index
